title: Kenya: KNUT Warns of Strike If Pay Hike Is Delayed
text:
Kenya: Kenya and U.S. Agree Deal On Stringent Measures to Stem Runaway Corruption By Felix Kipkemoi 
KNUT has asked the government to brace itself for a tough battle if it does not release funds for the 50 per cent salary increase for teachers. 
On June 30, the Labour Court awarded teachers a salary increase of between 50 and 60 per cent, but the Teachers Service Commission rejected the award. 
Knut secretary general Wilson Sossion said teachers are ready for any eventuality, even for a "longer and more nauseating nationwide strike". 
He spoke at Tenwek High School in Bomet on Saturday during the institution's prize giving day. Sossion said teachers will not enter a new deal with the government. Kenya
